doc.field: Megan O'Shea, Jennipher Ambrose, Molly A. Cross, and Alexa Logush
Megan O'Shea, Jennipher Ambrose, Molly A. Cross, and Alexa Logush
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Foreign Politics Serials
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Foreign Politics Serials

The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Foreign Politics Serials contains over 300 titles on politics in Europe, Canada, Asia, Latin America, Africa, and Oceania as well as international issues. The collection dates between 1850 and 2011, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1940s through 1980s. Topics include politics within countries other than the United States, issues in the Middle East and the Soviet Union in the early to mid-20th century, Palestinian independence movements, and the Cold War.

The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Foreign Politics Serials contains over 300 titles on politics in Europe, Canada, Asia, Latin America, Africa, and Oceania as well as international issues. The collection dates between 1850 and 2011, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1940s through 1980s. Topics include politics within countries other than the United States, issues in the Middle East and the Soviet Union in the early to mid-20th century, Palestinian independence movements, and the Cold War.
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Foreign Politics Serials contains over 300 titles on politics in Europe, Canada, Asia, Latin America, Africa, and Oceania as well as international issues. The collection dates between 1850 and 2011, with the bulk of the material dating from the 1940s through 1980s. Topics include national and local politics mainly within European countries, issues in the Middle East and the Soviet Union in the early to mid-20th century, Palestinian independence movements, and the Cold War. The collection includes titles published in the US on these topics, as well as on international affairs, including the Cold War and the Middle East. Other topics include issues of interest to immigrant communities, in particular Eastern European immigrants in the US; the World Federalist Movement; the Vietnam War; and topics of interest to minority and opposition groups in Iran, Israel, and South America. Large runs of titles include camb16, Commonwealth, and Informations Ouvri√®res.

This collection combines serials relating to foreign politics drawn from two discrete groups of material held by the Tamiment Library. The first was a partially inventoried backlog of serials, received by the library through donations, subscriptions, and in archival collections. The second group consisted of around 1,700 serials, newspapers, and magazines, organized by title as an artificial collection, referred to as Periodicals.001 or Boxed Newspapers. This material was combined, inventoried, and arranged and described in subject-based categories in 2017. The accession number related to this collection is 2017.049.
Due to the fragile nature of certain original materials, researchers may be required to consult microfilm copies, preservation photocopies, or digital images of material in this collection.
